867: A mysteriously linked pair of young women find their daily lives preempted by a strange boudoir melodrama that plays itself out in a hallucinatory parallel reality.

13614: An American scholar in Greece sets about improving a prostitute he’s infatuated with.

16588: Reykjavik teenager Paul suffers from schizophrenia. As Paul begins to behave more and more erratically, his parents have him committed to a mental institution. There he meets fellow patients Oli Beatle, Viktor and Peter, and the group attempt to get by despite their day-to-day life of captivity.

114167: A young educator raised by Gypsies works in the South of France and battles to diffuse escalating tensions between the Gypsy and Turkish communities.

2076: A frigid, beautiful housewife in Paris with a kinky, sadomasochistic imagination starts an afternoon job as a prostitute in a local brothel while her husband is away at work.

33407: Carles Santos plays several of his pieces on the piano. This film was made for the exhibit on Carles Santos Visca el piano! held at the Miro Foundation in the summer of 2006.

Skyscrapers of New York City, from the North River

117208: Three friends in their twenties are trying to do the impossible – have fun on a casual Friday night.

903: Mr. Freedom, a bellowing good-ol’-boy superhero decked out in copious football padding, jets to France to cut off a Commie invasion from Switzerland. Freedom joins forces with Marie Madeleine to combat lefty freethinkers, as well as insidious evildoers Moujik Man and inflatable Red China Man.

2112: Almost ten years of work culminates in the final installment of Peter Jackson’s epic trilogy, presenting the final confrontation between the forces of good and evil fighting for control of Middle-earth. Based on the timeless J.R.R. Tolkien classic and winner of 11 Academy Awards.
The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King

32739: Godard’s episode of the TV series, “Série noire” (1984), is a return to the tehemes of Passion and Contempt; a war of words between director, producer and acress during the production of a cheap television film.
Grandeur and Decadence of a Small Movie Concern

3348: A pushy boss forces her young assistant to marry her in order to keep her Visa status in the U.S. and avoid deportation to Canada.

96214: The less fortunate twin brother of a CIA agent is recruited for an international mission.

34502: Manuel abandons the routines of his life in Lisbon and boards a 15th century Portuguese caravel under pirate law. A betrayal onboard triggers a series of terrible events that Manuel overcome while keeping his moral principles intact.

29211: Three sequences are linked together in this short film by Straub.
The Bridegroom, the Comedienne and the Pimp

37709: Insurance salesman tries to get money from his hippie cousin by fulfilling his dream: Arraigning for John Lennon and Janis Joplin’s “second coming”.

12686: A 1982 science fiction film produced and directed by Slava Tsukerman that has become a cult classic on the midnight movie circuit.

36553: On the night of the discovery of a duplicate planet in the solar system, an ambitious young student and an accomplished composer cross paths in a tragic accident.

3180: Bogart plays a man convicted of murdering his wife who escapes from prison in order to prove his innocence.

108782: Mathieu Amalric plays a befuddled, womanizing professor whose complicated life takes a turn for the worse following the disappearance of a student, in Jean-Marie and Arnaud Larrieu’s wickedly fun comic thriller.

115091: Journalist Anne Roland explores the disturbing links behind her friend’s sudden disappearance, an ominous government research chemical, and a disturbing radio broadcast of unknown origin.

14675: Plot centers around how a young recruit faces the horrors of war. Character vascilates between wanting to fight and doubting his own courage. In midst of first bloody encounter, Youth runs away. After seeing dead and wounded, sense of shame leads him back to his unit.

102405: In this sexy, dark comedy, a lost L.A. housewife puts her idyllic hipster life in jeopardy when she tries to rescue a stripper by taking her in as a live-in nanny.

9207: Intense, erotic crime thriller with Gina Gershon as an ex-con who, after having a sexual liaison with neighbor Jennifer Tilly, joins forces with her to dupe gangster boyfriend Joe Pantoliano out of $2 million of laundered loot.

38676: Presented as a documentary, and using the footage of the victims to show the events “as they happened”, the tale follows a documentary film-maker’s investigation into the mysterious murders of three would-be television personalities in the lonely Pine Barrens of New Jersey.

54682: This actioner is the story of two spies — Jonathan Ecks, an FBI agent, and Sever, a rogue NSA agent — who are lifelong adversaries engaged in an elusive hunt. While they try to kill each other, they learn they may be on the same side.

36182: The mysterious disappearance of a man affects the lives of four different people, all living in loneliness in the suburbs of Quebec: the wife of the missing person, an aging ex-gambler, a young receptionist who want to share her life with somebody, and a father looking to help his family.

94538: A luxury ski resort in Switzerland. 12-year-old Simon lives in the industrial valley below, with his jobless sister. Every day, he takes the ski-lift to the opulent ski world above, stealing equipment from the rich tourists to resell to the local kids back down.

49191: Predatory sadomasochist Capt. Howdy scours Internet chat rooms for vulnerable teenage girls to lure them to his torture chamber. He succeeds with Genevieve, the daughter of veteran cop Mike Gage, and Mike must track them down before it’s too late.

1464: A contemporary romantic comedy set in New York: aspirant writer Jerry is happy to turn to his mentor and oracle Dobel, an aging artist who can provide useful opinions about almost everything, including Jerry’s tormented love life with Amanda…

1818: There’s something in this house… Something ancient and dark that remains still, hidden and silent. It can only wait, having been concealed in the shadows for years. In fact, its milieu is darkness.

32044: As a party of aristocrats gathers at the Vogelöd family manor house for a hunting weekend, the uninvited arrival of Count Oechst (Lothar Mehnert) interrupts their plans.

16391: The eccentric Captain Jack Sparrow, young Will Turner and stubborn beauty Elizabeth Swann continue their seven-seas adventures. Sparrow must face the tentacle-laden Davey Jones whom he owes a blood debt to. In doing so he will avoid eternal damnation.
Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest

3435: In a future neo-fascist Great Britain, mysterious anarchist vigilante V fights back against oppressors with terrorist tactics and finds an unlikely ally in a girl that he rescues.

202: A platoon of new marine recruits goes through intense basic training under a brutal drill sergeant but nothing can prepare them for the harsh realities of the Vietnam War.

35025: An ambitious debut for writer/director Bart Freundlich charting the unrest with a family who gather together for thanks giving.

28736: The first film Joris Ivens made when he returned from Eastern Europe is a film poem about Paris and Parisian life on the borders of the Seine river.

92703: Two actors wandered from house to house in the countryside in the roles of the photographer and the retoucher business man offering their photographic services to the people.

112939: When a grieving father in a downward spiral stumbles upon a box of his deceased son’s original music, he forms a rock ‘n’ roll band, which changes his life.

93559: One morning a woman awakes in a hut up in the mountains and finds herself enclosed by an insurmountable vitreously wall behind which there seems to be no life. With a dog, a cow and a cat she meets the new challenge in her life.

90636: When it comes to crime, Belgrade is same as any other modern metropolis, except for having its own serial killers. That blank is filled when a flower salesman begins strangling women. A popular, but very disturbed rock star soon becomes telepathically connected with the killer.

28652: The toast of French Intelligence, Hubert Bonisseur de la Bath – code name OSS 117 – has a new mission that takes him to the Bossa Nova Brazil of the 1960s. Teaming up with a sexy Mossad agent, he sets out to capture a Nazi blackmailer with an embarrassingly long list of WWII French collaborators.

29408: A couple of traditional fishermen are linked by a secret vote of chastity. One day, they take in a wounded gypsy man, out of their Christian piety. As time goes by, a relationship, and love emerges between the healthy young woman and the gypsy…

35141: Beautiful Gloria Wandrous, a New York fashion model engages in an illicit affair with married socialite Weston Liggett. However, Gloria’s desire for respectability causes her to reconsider her lifestyle.

133468: Based on the true story of two Czechoslovak soldiers sent to assassinate the head of the SS in 1942. SS-Obergruppenführer Reinhard Heydrich was the Reich’s number three and main architect for the ‘Final Solution’.

24442: The story of citizen Geesche Gottfried (Margit Carstensen), widowed Miltenberger, who killed 15 people, among them her mother, her father, her children, two husbands and other persons from her immediate environs…

44313: A group of newcomers – including River Phoenix, Samantha Mathis, Dermot Mulroney and Sandra Bullock – to the country music business seek love and stardom, in this drama from director Peter Bogdanovich.

45149: The story follows a meeting on Pina, employed by the consortium of agricultural land along the Po, with Adolfo, committed in a bookshop in Rome. It is the first meeting between the two, who met for correspondence with an ad in a magazine. No longer young, Pina and Adolfo are both lonely and looking.

27649: Luc Besson’s version of the story of Joan of Arc, starring Milla Jovovich as the girl whose visions help rid France of its oppressors.
The Messenger: The Story of Joan of Arc

24526: Ritchie Donovan is a professional thief whose luck has just run out. The only survivor from a heist that goes terribly wrong, Ritchie is sent to Russia to steal a priceless antique cross locked in the penthouse safe of a Moscow skyscraper.

44277: Officers Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck have to capture Pegleg Pete, who’s stolen Minnie’s dog and is holding it for ransom. A wild chase in a sawmill (including an extended battle to avoid the saw itself) is soon in order.

26577: Based on Kubrick’s pictorial for Look Magazine (January 18, 1949) entitled “Prizefighter,” “Day Of The Fight” tells of a day in the life of a middleweight Irish boxer named Walter Cartier, particularly the day of his bout with black middleweight Bobby James.

8994: Kirsty is brought to an institution after the death of her family, where the occult-obsessive head resurrects Julia and unleashes the Cenobites once again.

21516: A couple in the south of France non-sequentially spin down the highways of infidelity in their troubled ten-year marriage.

119734: A futuristic love story set in a world where emotions have been eradicated.

39199: A romantic comedy-drama film about five elderly residents of an Aegean island, which won four awards at the 37th Antalya “Golden Orange” International Film Festival, including the Golden Orange for Best Film.

43372: It’s summer. Peter (Vincent Rottiers) is seventeen years old. He slips away from the family home to get together with his friends. Beside a river, the teenagers play at scaring each other. It is the day of the accident.

40179: Jim Lane is a test pilot, whose professional life is dangerous, and whose personal life compensates for that danger by fast living and recklessness. As such, he lives from paycheck to paycheck, and is often in debt, but knows his lucrative job will eventually get him out of those debts.

27999: A former convict poses as a cop to retrieve a diamond he stole years ago.

41323: Despite her protestations and concerns over ominous signs, a young woman’s lover leaves for the sea to fish for sardines, but while he is out a terrible storm strikes. However, she finds out about Le Tempestaire, or Tempest Master, who has the power to speak to the wind and subdue it.
The Tempest: Poem on the Sea

23423: An Egyptian caterer kills various women in suburban Miami to use their body parts to bring to life a dormant Egyptian goddess, while an inept police detective tries to track him down.

2588: Peping, a criminology student, is recruited by his schoolmate, Abyong, to work as a part-time errand boy for a local syndicate that collects protection fees from various businesses in Manila. Abyong contacts Peping to join a “special project” that pays more than normal…

34234: With the help of the singer and dancer Dixie Leonhard US-Entertainer Eddie Sparks wants to bring some fun to the soldiers during World War II.

113754: A young lawyer from the city travels to the Gobi desert where he embarks on a series of adventures and challenges.

1783: The idealist William Wilberforce maneuvers his way through Parliament in 19th century England, endeavoring to end the British transatlantic slave trade.

54565: Process server Joe Tyler gets more than he bargained for when he’s asked to serve divorce papers to Sara Moore. Unwilling to give up the money she helped make for her cattle baron husband, Sara proposes a deal.

36265: After being cut down, shipped off to christmas tree dealers, and brought home and decorated in celebration of christmas, the trees are fed up with the humiliation and abuse, and take their revenge on humanity.

95485: The main characters are two “Don Juans”, professional “fiancees”, who travel the country in search of desperate women willing to spend money to find their soulmates.

110847: A documentary investigation of the world of French agriculture today through various testimonials. A world that manages to resist the upheavals that it faces – economic, scientific, social – and which continues, for better or for worse, to maintain the link between generations.

17348: Realizing she is at a crossroads in her life, bored twenty-something Taeko heads for the countryside. The trip dredges up forgotten childhood memories which unfold in flashback to younger years: the first immature stirrings of romance, the onset of puberty, and the frustrations of math and boys…

30296: Rayne, the half-human/half-vampire warrior, ventures to America’s 1880’s Wild West to stop the vampired Billy the Kid and his posse of vampire cowboys.

31360: A young girl is institutionalized by her wicked stepfather. Retreating to an alternative reality as a coping strategy, she envisions a plan which will help her escape from the facility.

3966: A tour of the Hotel des Invalides, and more particularly of the Army Museum and the Saint Louis Chapel. From François I’s armor to Guynemer’s airplane, to Napoleon’s and Marshall Foch’s tombs.

1937: Cal Trask, the ‘bad’ son of a California farmer, embarks on a business endeavour to prove his worthiness to his father. Tensions abound when he must deal with his estranged mother and begins to fall for the ‘good’ brothers girlfriend.

155149: Mark Chestnut, intern at the Ministry of the Standard, is sent to Guyana to the compliance with EU standards of construction GUYANEIGE: Amazon first indoor ski slope intended to boost tourism in Guyana. Also, he’s gonna have to work with a teammate. Bad luck she’s a pin-up. Worse, she has character.

33331: A stark adaptation of Flannery O’Connor’s short story A Good Man Is Hard To Find.

2740: Winner of the Un Certain Regard Prize at Cannes, this dark, offbeat film depicts the life of a strange family of five, where the adult children are sheltered from the outside world.

55493: In this sidesplitting sequel, Charlie Sheen returns as ham-fisted Lt. Topper Harley, who’s tapped for a risky mission to rescue American troops from the clutches of a Middle Eastern despot with a ferocious guard poodle.

13046: A handful of tourists looking for adventure get more than they bargained for when they cross paths with a massive man-eating beast in this thriller.

31204: After the assassination of President Abraham Lincoln, a young lawyer must defend the mother of one of the accused in a court of law when a lynch mob calls for her death upon the scaffold.

249: Two young hustlers, Mike and Scott, navigate a volatile world of junkies, thieves, and johns. They go on a quest along the grungy streets and open highways of the Pacific Northwest, in search of an elusive place called home.

2624: After the wild lifestyle of a famous young German photographer almost gets him killed, he goes to Palermo, Sicily to take a break. Can the beautiful city and a beautiful local woman help him calm himself down?

34198: Jörgen Hofmeester is desperately looking for his missing daughter Tirza and heading towards a brutal confrontation with the man who has been the undoing of his favorite child.

96522: A group of air crash survivors are stranded in the Mongolian desert with no chance of rescue. Facing a brutal environment, dwindling resources, and an attack by desert smugglers, they realize their only hope is doing the “impossible”—building a new plane from the wreckage.

114735: Fatih is a struggling musician whose efforts did not pay. Fatih makes a deal with the Devil that he will sell his soul in return for fame. However, times have changed, and humans have proved to be more evil and smarter than the Devil himself.

1853: Just released from residential psychiatry, gentle orphan Ricky pursues his pathological obsession: porn actress Marina. Penniless and without a chance to court her, he kidnaps her from the set of a crippled director Maximo’s last movie.  And that’s just the beginning…
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

33709: Young hopefuls trying to stage a Broadway show on a shoestring are sustained with food by expert shoplifter Harpo. They little suspect that his donations include the special sardine can hiding the Romanoff diamonds! Slinky Madame Egelichi and her henchmen will do anything to get them back, but the M

10711: Buster Keaton shoes horses and repairs cars, with mixed results

2378: A Taiwanese filmmaker makes a film based on the myth of Salomé at the Louvre. He gives the part of King Herod to the French actor Jean-Pierre Léaud. For the box-office, the production company gives the role of Salomé to a famous model. But problems arise as soon as filming begins…

149038: A documentary film about victims of Internet surveillance, how online spying works, and whether encryption is the answer.

32553: It’s Taxidermy Tech vs. Anthropology A&M for this introduction to college football (first piece of special equipment needed: a campus covered in ivy).

135220: Suspecting that people around him are turning into evil creatures, a troubled man questions whether to protect his only friend from an impending war, or from himself.

32437: During the WWII battle of Stalingrad, two snipers, a Russian, and a German, are locked in a battle of wills and marksmanship, while the Russian is boosted to the status of hero by a political official.

671: Louis Malle presents his meditative investigation of the inner workings of a French automotive plant.

97340: A bounty hunter from Germany posing as a traveling dentist comes to the aid of a freed slave named Django who sets out to rescue his captured wife from a notorious plantation owner in Mississippi.

30466: Greedy King Midas is granted his wish that everything he touches turns to gold. He learns his lesson, however, when everyone and everything he loves,including food, turns to gold as well.

1017: As he adjusts to being a husband and father, Ariel Perelman (Daniel Hendler) meditates on the ways in which he is similar — and so very different — from his own dad.

110167: After two years of hard work in Germany, where he went to earn the money he needs to marry the girl he loves, a young man returns to his village in Turkey.

4027: Bugs is in drag as the Valkyrie Brunhilde who sits on an overwieght horse. “She” is pursued by Elmer playing the demigod “Siegfried”.

35456: One day Mucjusz & his friend Malaj visit the mansion of Fabiusz, an old time friend of Mucjusz. Their sudden arrival makes Fabiusz anxious because years ago Mucjusz was in love with his beautiful wife Waleria. Malaj assures Fabiusz that during his wanderings he’s met many other women.

94383: Set in 1909, the film is from the POV of a dapper young man sent from England to Alberta to attempt ranching. It soon becomes clear that nothing in his refined upbringing prepared him for the harsh conditions of the New World.

37563: A random invitation to a Halloween party leads a man into the hands of a rogue collective intent on murdering him for the sake of their art, sparking a bloodbath of mishap, mayhem and hilarity.

111259: A struggling motel owner and her daughter are taken hostage by a nearly blind career criminal to be his eyes as he attempts to retrieve his cash package from a crooked cop.

48570: Retired judge Justin Playfair has a most peculiar eccentricity: He believes he’s Sherlock Holmes. Betrayed by his scheming brother and placed under the care of a psychiatrist, “Holmes” searches Manhattan for his elusive nemesis, Moriarty.

28221: A semi-documentary crime film loosely based on the real life story of a former police department employee and WW2 veteran who goes on a crime spree.

35532: A fairy tale about a man who wins his true love with the help of the “wee folk”… and the latest Post Office initiative.

106832: Both a visual flashback and a telling of the life and birth of the alter ego that was David Bowie’s Ziggy Stardust.
David Bowie: the Story of Ziggy Stardust

22325: Pierrot waxes romantic, entranced by the moon. Harlequin appears and bullies him, then uses a magic lantern to project an image of Columbine. Pierrot tries to court the illusory Columbine unsuccessfully, then enters a mystical moon-realm from which he returns dead.

40425: A Texas Ranger hunts for a hooded serial killer terrorizing the residents of a small town, set in 1946 Arkansas. Loosely based on a true story.

60636: Desperate for work for himself and his family, Ghassem hijacks an Iranian airplane, redirecting the flight towards a friendly Persian Gulf state. While most of the passengers like his plan, Ghassem finds his most difficult task is convincing his family to support him.

20374: A tale based on the life of Wilhelm Furtwangler, the controversial conductor of the Berlin Philharmonic whose tenure coincided with the controversial Nazi era.

102890: Two boys quarrel about a toy pistol. The game becomes serious. On the roof in a skyskraper district they risk their lifes for the toy pistol.

27271: A coming of age tale about teenage boy’s return home after being abandoned in a boarding school for eight years.

45571: The film follows Eggleston on trips to Kentucky, Los Angeles, New York and Memphis, where Eggleston lives.
William Eggleston in the Real World

25220: A girl arrives from London to visit her estranged relatives in a remote castle for the reading of her father’s will.
A Virgin Among the Living Dead

21282: The fox’ life in the forest, as well as the lives of the birds, the otters and the two young boys who lives nearby. It starts innocently enough on a beautiful summer`s day, with a fox playing and looking for food. But things soon get darker.

105995: This abstract narrative, dealing with the parallel themes of “Man with all knowledge” and “Child the father of man”, is a psycho-social exploration of nationhood, industrial progress and scientific development, as seen through the eyes of a child.

27315: The daughter of a brilliant mathematician, recently deceased, tries to come to grips with her possible inheritance: his insanity. Complicating matters are one of her father’s ex-students who wants to search through his papers and her estranged sister who shows up to help settle his affairs.

40789: Don Camillo is now a bishop, Peppone is now a senator, but their rivalry is as fierce as when they were just a village priest.

25344: Jandir and Vavá are two scums and small time crooks from Copacabana, who want to raise some easy money shooting compromising pictures of Leda and blackmailing her rich uncle. Leda convinces them to use her cousin Vilma, the daughter of the victim.

9026: Robin Hood, aging none too gracefully, returns exhausted from the Crusades to woo and win Maid Marian one last time.

35861: This is the story of Danny, a slave who has lived his whole life without any sort of normal human interaction, with the mind and personality of a young child. Treated like a dog, including being forced to wear a collar, by his owner/boss, Bart, Danny has been raised to be a lethal fighting machine.

49605: In director Dwight H. Little’s crime drama, Detective Harlan Regis gets a call to investigate a homicide at the White House and soon finds himself embroiled in a mystery involving the highest echelons of political power.

36616: Trnka’s sci-fi vision of the future in which machines and robots try to substitute themselves into the most beautiful human relationships. A cybernetic robot is supposed to substitute for the loving grandmother of a little girl.

596: A firebrand heiress clashes with her tyrannical father, a cattle rancher who fancies himself a Napoleon; but their relationship turns ugly only when he finds himself a new woman.

29154: A wide variety of eccentric competitors participate in a wild and illegal cross-country car race.

16405: Nene & Angel (Leonardo Sbaraglia, Eduardo Noriega) and their accomplice Cuervo (Pablo Echarri) participate in a botched bank robbery in 1965 Buenos Aires, then hide out from the police in Uruguay while the gang breaks down.

36772: Harry Shelby has been kept in knee pants for years by his overprotective parents, but the day finally comes when Harry is given his first pair of long pants.

37528: Matteo Scuro is a retired Sicilian bureaucrat (responsible mainly for the writing of birth certificates), a widower with five children, all of whom live on the mainland and hold responsible jobs. He decides to surprise each with a visit and finds none as he imagined.

1294: Elsa is convinced that Claire’s little girl Lola is the daughter she lost during a fire on the maternity ward. Elsa manipulatively inches her way into Lola’s life. An intense psychological face-off between two women who should never have met…Starring Sandrine Bonnaire and Catherine Frot.

35905: Torch singer Joan Gordon, tiring of her relationship with small-time hood and racketeer Eddie Fields, flees to Montreal and becomes the mail-order bride of down-to-earth farmer Jim Gilson. Their chance for happiness is threatened by Gilson’s own stubborness and the reappearance of Fields.

14530: A gangster hires an ex-football player to find his girlfriend. When he finds her, they fall in love, and the twists start to appear.

153701: In the year 2050, the Philippines braces for the coming of the fiercest storm ever to hit the country. And as the wind and waters start to rage, poets wander the streets.

56023: While being chased by neighborhood thugs, weak-kneed high school teacher Jefferson Reed is struck by a meteor and suddenly develops superhuman strength and abilities: He can fly, talk to dogs and absorb knowledge from any book in 30 seconds!

3169: A triumph of animation for both children and adults, this engaging story was adapted from the fairy tale of The Shepherdess and the Chimney Sweep by Hans Christian Andersen. Director Paul Grimault worked with the late and gifted Jacques Prevert.

30935: In this remake of the Spencer Tracy classic, George and Nina Banks are the parents of young soon-to-be-wed Annie…

50218: A serial killer in London is murdering young women whom he meets through the personal columns of newspapers; he announces each of his murders to the police by sending them a cryptic poem.

32518: A secret agent loses his memory after falling from a crashing helicopter. He is then chased by a number of other agency operatives, but he has no idea why.

109531: Made up of three short films—"Children", “Madonna and Child”, and “Death and Transfiguration”—the Trilogy acts as a reconstruction of the director’s childhood and youth in working class, post-war Liverpool.

2333: The film focuses on three city folks who unknowingly share the same apartment: Mei, a real estate agent who uses it for her sexual affairs; Ah-jung, her current lover; and Hsiao-ang, who’s stolen the key and uses the apartment as a retreat.

33742: Douglas Sirk directed this frothy musical comedy set in the 1920s starring Charles Coburn as Samuel Fulton, an elderly man with a multi-million dollar fortune.

89777: A pack of guitar-wielding hikers board the bus back to the city; a stranger falls hard for one of the passengers, the very young and very married Lena.

48697: The same summer that brings a man to the moon and free love to a small farm near Woodstock, N.Y., shakes up the safe, happy life of vacationing housewife Pearl Kantrowitz, who takes up with a mysterious traveling salesman.

30549: John and his girlfriend Shirley go in search of a cemetary in order to inspire John for writing his next horror story…

37684: Cartoon figures announce, via comic strip balloons, that they will move – and move they do, in a wildly exaggerated style.

13551: Documentary depicts what happened in Rio de Janeiro on June 12th 2000, when bus 174 was taken by an armed young man, threatening to shoot all the passengers.

32964: A musical comedy set in the fast-paced, fast-food world of competing falafel stands on the West Bank. David, an Israeli soldier, falls in love with Fatima, a beautiful Palestinian cashier, despite the animosity between their families’ dueling restaurants.

1138: Buck were friends when they were kids. Buck is still a 11-year-old who desperately misses his friend and the sex-games they played. But Chuck is now a successful music producer and he has a fiance. Buck starts off a quest for love that will have to face up to reality.

2257: I'm a Cyborg, But That's OK

32800: An American woman is stranded in Tokyo after breaking up with her boyfriend. Searching for direction in life, she trains to be a râmen chef under a tyrannical Japanese master.

94100: Orphan Pip rises from humble beginnings thanks to a mysterious benefactor. Moving through London’s class-ridden world as a gentleman, Pip uses his new status to pursue Estella, a beautiful, heartless heiress he’s always loved…

116317: Dima Nikitin is a simple and honest plumber who works in a small Russian town. Except for his unusual integrity, nothing makes him stand out of the crowd, until one night in a dorm mainly occupied by drunkards and outcasts, the pipes burst, endangering the occupants.

34997: Alma Mahler’s affair with the young architect Walter Gropius sets in motion a marital drama that forces her husband Gustav Mahler to seek advice from Sigmund Freud.

38904: Early short film by the French filmmaker Jacques Rozier. The film follows two teenage boys trying to pick up girls in a resort town.

19531: An Iowa corn farmer, hearing voices, interprets them as a command to build a baseball diamond in his fields; he does, and the Chicago Black Sox come.

98193: “Jellicle” cats join for a Jellicle ball where they rejoice with their leader, Old Deuteronomy. One cat will be chosen to go to the “Heavyside Layer” and be reborn. The cats introduce themselves.

45946: The original 70’s TV family is now placed in the 1990’s, where they’re even more square and out of place than ever.

24031: When a bus breaks down in the desert, the passengers decide to stage “King Lear.” The King Is Alive was the fourth Dogme film.

9109: Five kids are left home when their mother leaves town on a three-month vacation, only to have their geriatric babysitter die of a heart attack, leading to the eldest teen, Sue Ellen, to scam her way into taking a job at a hip Los Angeles fashion company to feed and support her needy siblings.
Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead

42793: Character study about Mildred, an elderly woman who has spent her life caring for others. When her daughter finally leaves home, she finds that, for the first time in her life, she has nobody to worry about – but soon becomes involved in the life of Monica.

26104: Believing that the world will end that very day, three mental patients Coco, Tsumuji and Satoru set out upon a journey. Walking upon the tops of the walls of the city, they seek to find a picnic spot with the best vantage point to view the final event.

24155: Dreamwood is one of the most abstract of avant-garde poet, playwright, and director James Broughton’s works. There is no plot; the film wanders from one sight to another.

103435: An anti-pop video featuring PJ Harvey entertaining herself with a little dance, wiggle about and some wiping of her nose.

41634: On a weekend trip to Hawaii, a plastic surgeon convinces his loyal assistant to pose as his soon-to-be-divorced wife in order to cover up a careless lie he told to his much-younger girlfriend.

23134: In a change from the usual action film, this story starts with the marriage of a young, uptight female martial-arts champion, Cheng Tai-nun (Hui Ying-hung) to an elderly and very wealthy landowner.

104454: Caradog James adds another layer to the Frankenstein story in the latest gripping sci-fi adventure to come out of the U.K. Already deep into a second Cold War, Britain’s Ministry of Defence seeks a game-changing weapon…

40812: A provocative French thriller places a wealthy man at the center of an extraordinary plot after a car crash leaves him unable to remember who he is.

99101: A haptic animation with comfortable noses. I wish everyday was a day of nose.

159761: An in-depth look at the prison system in the United States and how it reveals the nation’s history of racial inequality.

23050: Blue collar Malmö in the depressed ’30s, and as Berggren crafts his first novel in the back bedroom, mother Storm is worn out by years of picking up after her alcoholic husband Hjelm.

27196: On January 11, 2008, Josh Cohen and his partners, attorneys for the City of Cleveland, sue the 21 banks that they deem responsible for the real estate foreclosures that have devastated the city. But the Wall Street banks that they attack oppose going to trial by every means possible

84776: During a layover in Buenos Aires, 31-year-old German athlete Maria is mesmerized by the city, and her bewilderment grows when her father suddenly reveals her true connection to Argentina — leading her to uncover the painful details of her adoption.
The Day I Was Not Born

626: Through the eyes of sister and brother Fanny and Alexander Ekdahl, the many ups-and-downs of the extended Ekdahl family at the turn-of-the-twentieth-century are put on display in the director’s 312-minute, full length version, made for Swedish television.

10622: Two space cadets crash-land on a desert planet, where an evil wizard seeks the ultimate power to take over the world. Although the movie borrows some background footage from Star Wars, the plot is mostly unrelated.
Turkish Star Wars: The Man Who Saves the World

3011: The story of an unsophisticated fairground boxer whose girlfriend falls for the charms of a professional Australian fighter.

30431: The savage deconstruction of the relationship between image and reality. “Yes, Hello?”, “Look at that picture,” “Does it seem to be persisting?”, “Good. Thank you”.

52331: Takuma “Terry” Tsurugi returns. In this sequel, he sets out to bust up a phony charity put together by the Yukuza.

13429: A graduate history student is unwittingly caught in the middle of an international conspiracy involving stolen diamonds, an exiled Nazi war criminal, and a rogue government agent.

1040: A successful fashion photographer learns that he has a tumor that will soon kill him. Hiding his diagnosis, he alienates his family and his young boyfriend, but during a stay with his grandmother, his vulnerability is met with a big heart and sound advice.

3175: A group of people are involuntarily thrown together in a deadly labyrinth. They discover that each hold a key to unlocking the maze as a mathematical formula for escape begins to reveal itself. Their survival is threatened as they begin to turn on one another.

108777: Woody Allen plays as bookseller-turned-pimp to John Turturro’s middle-aged neophyte hustler, in actor-writer-director Turturro’s inspired left-field comedy.

155526: Mitsuha, a small town country girl, and Taki, a city boy from Tokyo, two high school kids who’ve never met are united through their dreams.

1124: Vince, who has just rented a room in a motel on his return to his hometown, is visited by Jon, an old high school friend, to whom he has never forgiven the stealing and  possibly raping his high-school girlfriend, Amy. The two talk all night in the hotel room until Amy arrives.

30555: A bunch of Satanists in the American rural landscape have terrible powers which enable them to melt their victims. However one of the children of an earlier victim vows to destroy them.

110054: This quietly expansive documentary offers an involving, revelatory portrait of performer and trans woman Coral Bonelli and her actress-mother, who reminisce about Coral’s personal and artistic evolution since the 70s, when she was child actor “Pinolito” in Mexico’s film industry.

1288: Set in a Japanese village at the end of the nineteenth century, the film details the downfall of a married woman and her lover after they murder her husband and dump his body in a well. With eroticism and horror, Oshima plunges the viewer into a nightmarish tale of guilt and retribution.

6145: Despite her mother’s objections, the naive young daughter of a show boat captain is thrust into the limelight as the company’s new leading lady.

35919: Documentary about war photographer James Nachtwey, considered by many the greatest war photographer ever.

57265: This groundbreaking Korean film stars Kang-hie Choi as Se-yeon Choi, an intrepid teacher at an all-girls school whose prying ways are awarded with a murder-mystery she now must unravel.

14950: A powerful and stark semi-documentary look at the horrors of Harlem ghetto slum life filled with drugs, violence, human misery, and a sense of despair due to the racial prejudices of American society.

37948: A story of the influence of modern life on a woman, who meets a man in a sculptor’s studio, has an affair, and is found dead.

4114: In a world where the dead rise to menace the living, rogue soldier Crocket leads a band of military dropouts to refuge from the endless chaos.

2083: After hundreds of lonely years doing what he was built to do, Wall-E discovers a new purpose in life when he meets a sleek search robot named EVE. He subsequently stumbles upon the key to the planet’s future.

29148: An abstract syn-aesthetic animation about what spooks get up to at night.

4070: Plucked from his childhood village, subjected to years of vigorous ballet training and threatened during the Cultural Revolution, Cunxin decides to leave China at great risk to himself and those he loves, for an uncertain future.

39492: Directed, produced by and starring motion-picture pioneer William Dickson, it displays a 3 second clip of him passing a hat in front of himself, and reaching for it with his other hand.

158527: In a fast growing city of East China, migrants have been arriving and living for a dream of a better life. But what they find there is little opportunities and poor living conditions that push people, even couples, into violent and oppressive relations.

99079: A rookie cop takes on a veteran escape driver in a death defying final showdown on the motorway…

125565: When Diana’s husband returns home one night with big news—he has taken on a second wife, and expects Diana to live in harmony with the situation—she does what is least expected and plans to make a life on her terms. Features a magnetic performance by Indonesian actress Raihaanun.

42547: In this explosive martial arts action adventure, college student Jake Lo is pursued by smugglers, mobsters and crooked federal agents after he witnesses a murder by a Mafia kingpin.

87405: The story of an insecure young mother (Claudia Pandolfi) who rents an apartment from a gruff mountain guide (Filippo Timi) in the hopes that the move will improve her baby’s health.

23128: A lonely middle-aged catering manager spends all of his time studying tapes of an eccentric TV chef…

85828: Goofy’s son Max heads to college, eager to experience the freedom of living away from home. But when Goofy loses his job, he gets sent back to school himself, ending up at the same college as Max.

20323: Follow the Manhattan-based Beavan family as they abandon their high consumption 5th Avenue lifestyle and try to live a year while making no net environmental impact.

21179: A woman leaves a party, goes home, and is found dead the next day, killed by her own hand. Why did she want to die? Flashbacks show who she was and the people she met. Will her secret die with her?

46999: An Egyptian high priest travels to America to reclaim the bodies of ancient Egyptian princess Ananka and her living guardian mummy Kharis.

27342: A huge, run-down apartment in Berlin Mitte. Two women and a man, rehearsals for a movie about love and sex, that will never be shot. Acting and reality mingle into a dangerous melange.

100622: A feature-length deluge of incessant, brilliant bursts of images (short takes and jump cuts, single frames in series, freeze-frames slightly altered between takes) it creates a Joyce-like, dense and somber mosaic of memory and sensory impressions.

26118: In an alternate Victorian Age world, a group of famous contemporary fantasy, SF and adventure characters team up on a secret mission.

80464: Mild-mannered convenience store owner Kenji realizes that several strange events — including the rise of a cult and the outbreak of a deadly virus — mirror the occurrences that he and his childhood friends predicted in their Book of Prophecies.
20th Century Boys: Chapter 1: Beginning of the End

23284: A wheelchair-bound young woman returns to her father’s estate after ten years, and although she’s told he’s away, she keeps seeing his dead body on the estate.

24149: Over two decades, an unlikely friendship blossoms between two pen pals: an eight-year-old Australian girl who picks a name at random and an obese middle-aged New Yorker suffering from Asperger’s.

9071: The earliest celluloid film was shot by Louise Le Prince using the Le Prince single-lens camera made in 1888…

25313: An American journalist travels throughout the world in search of a good story by joining a modern-day harem.

47413: A murderer deals with a whole new set of problems after a couple steals the car in which he has stored his wife’s body.

6: The newly married Mathilde and Robert are honeymooning at a resort owned by their friends Edith and Arthur. But a wicked villain has other plans for them that only a pair of investigators can solve…
The Perfume of the Lady in Black

27226: A master sorcerer in modern day Manhattan recruits a seemingly average guy as an apprentice to help defeat his arch-nemesis.

38564: We are first presented a cobweb castle, filled with the haunting doubts of the young protagonist. Spirits appear on the screen and are heard on the soundtrack. Gradually a female guide emerges and escorts the young man into an antechamber to another (and possibly higher) world.

35952: Story of Evaristo and Luis Antonio – indigenous brothers from the Sierra Tarahumara in northwest Mexico – who have just graduated from boarding elementary school.

90259: A comedy centered on the life of Kate Reddy, a finance executive who is the breadwinner for her husband and two kids.
I Don't Know How She Does It

37903: Perception is the key to Sergei Loznitsa’s wordless B&W film-essay “The Settlement,” which gradually envelops the viewer in the day-to-day activities of a rural mental institution in Russia.

3292: A girl brings home her latest boyfriend to meet her parents. This is done against the background of random shootings that had just begun in NYC at the time the play was written. How the family’s failings are magnified by the social confusion of the times is the crux of the plot.

36641: Cartographer Will Shepard hits the road for his latest job: to create a new, more accurate satellite survey of Armenia. During his assignment, he forms a bond with an Armenian expatriate and art photographer.

35836: The Black Lizard, a mysterious female jewel thief, becomes involved in a cat and mouse game of theft, kidnapping and homicide with a jeweler, his beautiful daughter and detective Akechi, with whom the Black Lizard shares a special bond.

29103: During the occupation, a man loses his wife and daughter to Nazi bullets. He vows to personally kill every one of the Germans responsible (along with a few who weren’t) in order to assuage his grief.

16452: A group of twenty-something friends, most of whom live in the same apartment complex, search for love and success in grunge-era Seattle.

91167: The video serves as a publicity campaign for the movie, as it includes brief scenes of the film that indicate the conflict the young man in the movie played by Sean Penn feels.

5261: Stephen Arden sends his girlfriend, Amanda Cooper, to his good friend, Dr. Tony Flagg, who is a psychiatrist, and wants him to find out why she keeps postponing their marriage.

15989: In World War I London, Myra is an American out of work chorus girl making ends meet by picking up men on Waterloo Bridge.

2200: Weary of the conventions of Parisian society, a rich playboy and a youthful courtesan-in-training enjoy a platonic friendship, but it may not stay platonic for long.

32857: Charlie is an overworked labourer at a film studio who helps a young woman find work even while his coworkers strike against his tyrannical boss.

129611: In 1976, a psychology lab in Pennsylvania became the home to the only government-confirmed case of possession. The details of the inexplicable events that occurred are being made public after remaining classified for nearly forty years.

28191: Twenty years after the murder of Alice Barlow, her house is finally occupied again. However, the husband of the couple who have moved in has a secret which he will do anything to keep hidden.

30962: When a boy learns that a beloved killer whale is to be killed by the aquarium owners, the boy risks everything to free the whale.

116224: Kommunisten is comprised of six parts: Le Temps du mépris, shot in Rolle, Switzerland, in July 2014 and based on André Malraux’s novel of the same name.

36489: A four-time widow discusses her four marriages, in which all of her husbands became incredibly rich and died prematurely because of their drive to be rich.

38837: This haunting and oppressive animation represents a daring attempt to portray not the reality of the camps, but their atmosphere.

47824: Martin Šulík’s groundbreaking portrait of Roma life in present-day Slovakia focuses on a young boy whose father has suffered a violent death.

As she gets closer to the answer, she’s more and more convinced that Aku’s treatment of former sect members is important.

22095: Semi-autobiographical story of Conrad Rooks, who travels to France to undergo a drug-withdrawal cure…

46602: A young humanoid alien who gets stranded on earth hooks up with a grizzled old sheriff in a western town and tries to help him solve a tough case, but the sheriff doesn’t want any help from a “kid.”

Old Men in New Cars: In China They Eat Dogs II

64688: Having supernatural powers isn’t easy: Just ask transfer student Kim, who’s been booted from eight high schools for not controlling his special abilities.

25190: A slick New York publicist who picks up a ringing receiver in a phone booth is told that if he hangs up, he’ll be killed… and the little red light from a laser rifle sight is proof that the caller isn’t kidding.

87956: An overweight man goes on an all juice diet, inspiring others.

43756: A recently married scholar goes on a quest for knowledge of other people’s wives, based on his philosophical differences with the Sack Monk. He encounters the Flying Thief, who agrees to help him find women, but only if he attains a penis as big as a horse’s.

107608: Often cited as the “first fashion film,” Claxton used this is an experiment of women’s imaginative ways of creating self-image. In the sixties, while defining female sexuality through fashion and the world of power in art.

100099: On the mean streets of Manhattan, Ewa falls prey to Bruno, a charming but wicked man who takes her in and forces her into prostitution.

20634: Police corruption interferes with the search for a killer in Yorkshire, England. Based on David Peace’s novel “Nineteen Eighty”.

42134: Every year, four veterans of the colonial war gather to celebrate the achievements of the war and keeping the group together. 27985: When Trish decides to invite her high school girl’s basketball teammates over for a slumber party she makes three big mistakes in “The Ultimate Driller Killer Thriller”.

22665: After a plane crash in the Sahara, one of the survivors says he’s an airplane designer and they can make a flyable plane from the wreckage.

103292: A series of snapshots from the life of a fictional actress named Shirley serves to weave together thirteen paintings by Edward Hopper (e.g. “Office at Night”, “Western Motel”, “Usherette”, “A Woman in the Sun”) into a fascinating synthesis of painting and film, personal and political history.

21812: An actress, a writer, a student, and a government worker band together in an effort to escape Paris as the Nazis move into the city.

42050: After being abducted as children, and suffering years of abuse, a teenage boy and girl find themselves living on the street.

24696: During the US Civil War, Union POWs escape in a balloon and end up stranded on a South Pacific island, inhabited by giant plants and animals. They must use their ingenuity to survive the dangers, and to devise a way to return home.

99912: Gina and Marco are both very young and are determined to be “someone.”

119728: A teenage girl with nothing to lose joins a traveling magazine sales crew, and gets caught up in a whirlwind of hard partying, law bending and young love as she criss-crosses the Midwest with a band of misfits.

21976: A Cambodian boxer smuggled into Hong Kong is pursued by a hotheaded young cop with serious authority issues.

40001: In this short film shot entirely on the Apple iPhone 4, a fisherman becomes entangled in his own line when he catches something unexpected.

38073: An accidental cross-time radio link connects father and son across 30 years. The son tries to save his father’s life, but then must fix the consequences.

39229: The story of two rival brothers, one a pimp and the other a cop, and how the former manages to be the family favorite.

98498: A young man earns a second chance in romance as he sees the woman of his dreams in a building across the street from his office.

24946: A combination of live footage of Michael Jackson in concert as well as a series of fantasy pieces with Jackson as the central character.

47104: In this full-length feature of Hanna-Barbera’s cat and mouse duo, Tom and Jerry are trying to help an orphan girl who is being berated and exploited by a greedy guardian.

41093: Probably no one in the public listening to the orchestra’s rendition of Ravel’s Bolero notices him but the drummer is a regular hero. For, although his mind is assailed by loads of unsettling thoughts and worries, he tries to keep the rhythm at any cost.

27655: A promotional video by Don Van Vliet to promote the album Lick My Decals Off, Baby.

83378: Jiro usually spends his birthday alone, but this year, he gets the gift of a lifetime when a goofy but beautiful girl celebrates the occasion with him — only to vanish mysteriously at the end of the night.

Alexander Korda’s first major international success is a raucous, entertaining, even poignant peek into the boudoirs of the infamous king and his six wives.
The Private Life of Henry VIII

12200: Harrowing story of a young Jewish girl who, with her family and their friends is forced into hiding in an attic in Nazi-occupied Amsterdam.

31218: A failed parole officer framed for murder must enlist the help of his former clients to clear his name.

34184: Rafting expert Gail takes on a pair of armed killers while navigating a spectacularly violent river.

115573: The song, “My Valentine,” is translated into sign language.

2638: A woman in search of her missing sister uncovers a Satanic cult in New York’s Greenwich Village, and finds that they may have something to do with her sibling’s random disappearance.

97764: David Fincher’s music video for Paula Abdul’s song “Straight Up”.

255: This Palme d’Or-winning international sensation chronicles seven days in the life of a playboy paparazzo named Marcello Rubini as he gallivants around the vibrant city of Rome.

32013: Michel Deville’s thriller about a guitar teacher who has an affair with the mother of one of his pupils and then also becomes involved with a professional killer who has a contract to murder the pupil’s father.

1557: Three interlocking stories set in the legendary New York City dance palace Roseland make up this charming film, the third to be shot by Merchant Ivory Productions in America, and featuring Teresa Wright, Christopher Walken, and Lilia Skala.

3506: The disappearance of an inmate at an insane asylum on a remote island prompts two U.S. marshals to launch an investigation there, leading to only more questions about the mysterious asylum and the people that inhabit it.

331: Idealistic high school teacher Dan Dunne leads a secret life of addiction. When a troubled student makes the startling discovery of his habit, a tenuous bond grows, that threatens either to undo them or provide a catalyst of hope for change.

68347: The socially inept Solomon brothers go on a quest to grant their dying father’s last wish to have a grandchild in this quirky comedy. But because their dad home-schooled them in the wilds of the Arctic, the guys have no idea how to relate to women.

28605: In post-apocalyptic Eurasia, a new breed of mutants called “neo-humans” rise to annihilate human race.

92630: After a shootout on a flight transporting prisoners, a stewardess must outwit a smooth-talking serial killer and land the plane herself.

71592: Mary and Joseph make the hard journey to Bethlehem for a blessed event in this meticulously researched and visually lush adaptation of the biblical tale of the Nativity from director Catherine Hardwicke (Thirteen).

90705: When the construction of a new house causes a dispute among neighbors, the fragile social fabric of a village comes undone, as rivalries, fears, and old, unsettled scores start to emerge.

2594: A chain-smoking Los Angeles private investigator named Philip Marlowe unwittingly comes to the aid of his friend who is suspected of murdering his wife.

113748: Norway, winter. Introverted and hard-working Nils drives the powerful snow plough that keeps open the roads and mountain passes of the inhospitable frozen landscape where he lives…

6452: Director Matías Bize’s erotic chamber piece details the debauched encounter between two strangers as they retreat to a seedy hotel room for an unbridled night of passion, only to find their personal boundaries and preconceptions about one another challenged as they attempt to get better acquainted.

95499: A priest from the Vatican is sent to Sao Paulo, Brazil to investigate the appearance of the face of the Virgin Mary on the side of a building.

131976: A glamorous woman returns to her small town in rural Australia. With her sewing machine and haute couture style, she transforms the women and exacts sweet revenge on those who did her wrong.

36279: A doctor’s daughter is kidnapped and buried alive, and he is given just five hours to find and rescue her.

46271: Steelhead arrives in Japan amongst a number of Chinese refugees and journeys to Tokyo in search of his girlfriend Xiu Xiu. Here he befriends immigrants Jie and Old Ghost and tracks down Xiu Xiu who has adopted a new name and a new life.

24571: “Beatles Electronique” reveals engagement with manipulation of pop icons.

19071: Charlie is a fireman who always does everything wrong. A man talks the Fire Chief into ignoring his burning home (he wants the insurance money) unaware that his daughter (the love of the Chief) is upstairs in the house.

26520: A spider runs a hotel for flies where he keeps his guests captive. A pair of fly newlyweds arrive and check in.
