1978: A dramatic feature based on material from the incendiary book Fast Food Nation, a no-holds-barred exploration of the fast food industry that ultimately revealed the dark side of the “All American Meal.”

32124: Chucky hooks up with another murderous doll, the bridal gown-clad Tiffany, for a Route 66 murder spree with their unwitting hosts, two eloping high-school graduates.

3555: Ingmar Bergman’s psychological study of how humans react in a situation of war. The film takes place on Gotland, where invasion forces arrives.

1504: Before checking himself into a hospital for treatment of a terminal illness from which he may never recover, celebrated writer Alexandre spends one last day wandering about town and reminiscing about his past, trying to capture one perfect moment of happiness from his memories.

88111: A sad young woman wanders around. Sometimes she holds a cat. It does have a mood of melancholy.

30175: A cynical Welsh hotel owner secretly romances a diplomat’s wife in Haiti under the violent reign of the despot “Papa Doc” Duvalier.

95602: A strange creature races against time to make the most important and beautiful creation of his life.

51802: From 1912 to 1920, a group of fiery young suffragettes led by Alice Paul and Lucy Burns band together to wheedle the United States into adapting a Constitutional amendment guaranteeing women the right to vote.

117415: 120 fragments in 6 chapters, matching 120 nights in Tokyo, Osaka or elsewhere.

28986: Zedd plays D.B. Shane, a dead star who visits a fan in her dreams, kisses her then kills her.

3431: 101-year-old Rose DeWitt Bukater tells her grandchildren the story of her ill-fated romance with penniless artist, Jack Dawson. Whom she met on the maiden voyage of the similarly fated ship, the Titanic.

155062: Richard longs to put down roots but his restless and destructive brother, Polly needs to keep moving. When the land they live on is bought by a new landowner, and the electricity supply to their caravan is cut, their already precarious living conditions get even worse.

10202: Weaves multiple stories to create a witty look at love, family and the sheer unpredictablity of life itself.

30011: The story of Rene (Jean-Pierre Leaud) who falls in love with a troubled movie star Jenie (Christine Boisson), living at rue Fontaine.

13009: Kevin Lomax, a ruthless young Florida attorney that never lost a case, is recruited by the most powerful law firm in the world. But soon, his wife starts feeling homesick as she witnesses devilish apparitions.

1460: Frankfurt 1978. In an attempt to escape from her own past, Elvira Weishaupt (Volker Spengler) looks for refuge within a circle of people familiar to her. When she only encounters derision and rejection she is left with only one option …

149957: Capturing life on the Italian island of Lampedusa, a frontline in the European migrant crisis.

133508: In the form of an animated docu-drama, the biography of Adam Jacek Winker wonders through nearly half a century of history.

92707: As Rincewind involuntarily becomes a guide to the naive tourist Twoflower, they find themselves forced to flee the city of Ankh-Morpork to escape a terrible fire, and begin on a journey across the Disc.

29914: We follow the daily activities of two London bobbies, veteran George Dixon and rookie Andy Mitchell. Meanwhile, young hoods Tom and Spud plan a series of robberies with Tom’s girl Diana, a discontented beauty, as inside worker.

49239: In this stinging indictment of the media age, Robert De Niro plays Eddie Fleming, a legendary Manhattan detective who teams with a naïve arson investigator to nab two Eastern European crooks.

29568: Set in a world with memory implants, Robin Williams plays a cutter, someone with the power of final edit over people’s recorded histories. His latest assignment is one that puts him in danger.

16039: Two Boston area detectives investigate a little girl’s kidnapping, which ultimately turns into a crisis both professionally and personally. Based on the Dennis Lehane novel.

35021: Searching for a cure to Alzheimer’s disease a group of scientists on an isolated research facility become the bait as a trio of intelligent sharks fight back.

28732: Viewers are presented with items from Benning’s collection of Hank Aaron memorabilia, one item at a time, seen front and back, organized in chronological order, year by year, while excerpts from the diary of Arthur Bremer scroll across the bottom of the screen from right to left.

91814: Around the year 2000, a terrible occurence shocks the city of Athens: a huge piece of moussaka appears on the city streets, spreading panic and death. Everyone keeps wondering: why, where, how, for what reason? But no one can give an answer…
The Attack of the Giant Moussaka

53783: A father and daughter’s move to a new home in the suburbs is anything but lucky when they discover that a murderous 600-year-old leprechaun is living in their basement, laying waste to all who interfere with the search for his pot of gold.

131841: Noah Baumbach and Jake Paltrow’s fleet and bountiful portrait covers the career of the number one iconoclast of American cinema, the man who gave us Carrie, Dressed to Kill, Blow Out, and Carlito’s Way

28656: Little Sherina must leave her good friends behind in Jakarta when her father takes a better job on a plantation in the countryside…

75407: Happy-go-lucky playboy Tom finally decides to propose to his best friend, Hannah, when she returns from a trip. But when she gets home, she announces that she’s engaged — and asks Tom to be in the wedding.

35145: Two brothers develop a very close relationship as they are growing up in an idyllic and happy family. When they are young adults their relationship develops into something very intimate, romantic and sexual.

50588: This satirical comedy starring Jeremy Piven, Chris Young and Jon Favreau follows the high jinks of a band of renegade college students out to unveil the idiocy behind blind political correctness at Port Chester University.

99941: In Manhattan, a bike messenger picks up an envelope that attracts the interest of a dirty cop, who pursues the cyclist throughout the city.

105232: When a veteran 911 operator takes a life-altering call from a teenage girl who has just been abducted, she realizes that she must confront a killer from her past in order to save the girl’s life.

23508: In this lyrical and poetic consideration of the life of revered Harlem Renaissance poet Langston Hughes, film-maker Isaac Julien invokes Hughes as a black gay cultural icon, against an impressionistic, atmospheric setting that parallels a Harlem speakeasy of the 1920s with an 80s London nightclub.

21559: Student Raskolnikow, who has written an article about laws and crime, proposing the thesis, that un-ordinary people can commit crimes if their actions are necessary for the benifit of mankind, murders an old woman,  who made the mistake of visiting her at the wrong time.

20703: Recalling her own childhood antics, contentious French auteur Catherine Breillat retells Charles Perrault’s classic serial killer yarn.

21841: In 1978, complex political and emotional forces are set in motion when a young man returns to the race-torn Philadelphia neighborhood where he came of age during the Black Power movement.

87141: A young woman takes a sand bath. Once again in this film, Saturn has great fun undressing its models.

40136: Two feuding rock stars get handcuffed together for 24 hours at a music festival where they are both due to perform.

22636: Fielding Pierce (Billy Crudup) is a promising young congressional candidate who becomes obsessed with the idea that his dead lover, Sarah (Jennifer Connelly), is still alive.

118445: A group of men is returning from a winter fishing trip on a yacht. When a mechanical problem leaves them trapped on their boat, somewhere in the gulf of Saronikos, they will kill their time playing a game they devise called Chevalier.

25987: Wang Bianlian is an aging street performer known as the King of Mask for his mastery of Sichuan Change Art in a true story.

42167: A swarm of moths tear into “Ye Olde Costume Shop” as one pretty girl moth is beguiled by a hypnotic candle flame.

118839: Guided by the sheepbells of a flock and by the evocations of the lost, this film is a voyage through storms; those of the mountains and winter, those of bodies and souls, those which remind us that which nature has not obtained from our reason, obtaining from our madness.

23810: A man trying to get away from it all finds both love and conflict in the woods in this offbeat drama from Lithuania.

21791: A trio of Danish comedians, calling themselves “the Red Chapel” and pretending to be regime sympathizers, infiltrate North Korea as part of a cultural exchange and mount an absurd variety show.

25657: Although not so well-known as others East European cinemas (Polish or Czech, for instance), the Romanian school managed to produce several high-quality movies. One of them — some would say the best — is “Why do they ring the bells, Mitică?”
Why Are the Bells Ringing, Mitică?

44238: Women get men to take them seriously by wearing miniature model breasts on their foreheads.

26538: Kieslowski’s later film Dworzec (Station, 1980) portrays the atmosphere at Central Station in Warsaw after the rush hour.

99691: An Israeli-Palestinian surgeon, shocked to discover that his wife was involved in a suicide-bomb attack, ventures into Palestinian territory to confront the people who recruited her, in this gripping adaptation of Yasmina Khadra’s international bestseller.

122040: Ben is an art college student in London, whose imagination runs wild as he works the late-night shift at the local supermarket. What do he and his colleagues do to pass the long, endless hours of the night?

25733: Tom Ripley persuades a man to commit a murder for a large sum of money. The situation goes out of control, and that man must escape trouble.

38020: Tony’s father Sam, abducted by aliens three years earlier, returns to earth and seeks out his wife and son…

26944: Yuuji, a yakuza who makes his living carrying out assassinations for a local crime boss in Taiwan, is barely scraping by when a woman from his past shows up with some unexpected baggage: his son. But does Yuuji have it in him to be a father?

24569: Werner Nekes filmed a Finnish landscape from a fixed point of view and just panned steady and slow around. What becomes of these experimental shots is a wonderful, universal, gigantic wall of pictures.

46269: White hunter Captain Fry tries to take Tarzan back to civilization, caged for public display. He arrives in the jungle with Jane’s cousins, Eric and Rita who want Jane’s help in claiming a fortune left her.

8357: During World War II, Captain Walker and his wife Nora spend an idyllic day in the country before he returns to duty, but soon after he is reported missing. Nora gives birth to a healthy boy, Tommy, and even though still grieving for Walker she later marries another man. But Walker still walks…

101978: Yosemite Sam is a-lookin’ for any varmint what dares to tame him. And Bugs is just the varmint.

24035: Alan is an all-star Harvard man. He’s ambitious, intelligent, and star of the college basketball team, juggling two girlfriends, trying to get money to help his family, dealing with the mob, and facing the FBI, while trying to decide whether he should throw the next game. What will he do?

41884: A tattered old bunny baking in his kitchen is pestered by an equally tattered old moth.

101504: Dark north. Clarity upon waking. Beneath an expanse of sky, a night of flesh absorbed in fever.

38418: French colonists in Africa, several months behind in the news, find themselves at war with their German neighbors.

9069: In ‘Round Midnight, real-life jazz legend Dexter Gordon brilliantly portrays the fictional tenor sax player Dale Turner, a musician slowly losing the battle with alcoholism, estranged from his family, and hanging on by a thread in the 1950’s New York jazz world.

24151: As his town is flooded by water, an old man is forced to add additional levels onto his home with bricks (cubes) in order to stay dry.

42797: Eddie Rico has been the book-keeper of an important Mafia boss but now he is an honest merchant and lives with his family in Florida. Everything changes when the police starts to search for his brothers. Now Eddie sees himself forced to get in touch with the Mafia again.

26100: In this short film by Romanian director Corneliu Porumboiu, a man named Liviu wakes up one morning from a disturbing dream that he cannot remember. All he knows of his nighttime vision is that it has changed his view of the world, and has perhaps coincided with the birth of his child.

38864: This big hit at the Sundance Film Festival had audiences cheering. Set during the Ming Dynasty, this acclaimed production tells the story of a power hungry eunuch who employs an evil sect in his quest to rule China. An extravagant climax features dizzying acrobatics and masterful fight sequences.

23130: Kowalski is the last American hero, a man setting out to prove he can drive from Denver to San Francisco in just fifteen hours. Along the way, while recalling episodes from his past, Kowalski meets an old prospector, a nude woman on a motorcycle, and a blind D.J., who “sees” that danger is ahead…

104450: Teenagers did not exist before the 20th century. Not until the early 1950s did the term gain widespread recognition, but with Teenage, Matt Wolf offers compelling evidence that “teenagers” had a tumultuous effect on the previous half-decade.

104534: Vividly depicts the young lives of two brothers as they abruptly come of age through the experience of a friend’s mysterious death. The event ripples under the surface of their town, unsettling the brothers and their friends in a way that they can’t fully understand.

24399: Moody realism conveys a stark poetry in this tale of a cab driver stuck with an abandoned baby in his back seat.

23054: Ichak Fintzi plays the painter Czontvary (1854-1919) in this biographical drama. The gifted artist was recognized over 30 years after his death by a communist country that considered him to be “rehabilitated” by the 1950s.

46499: A half-shark, half-octopus creature created for the military, creates a whole lot of terror in Mexico while a scientist who helped created it tries to capture/kill it.

41754: An American occult novelist battles to save the soul of a young girl from a group of Satanists, led by an excommunicated priest, who plan on using her as the representative of the Devil on Earth.

5232: A tale of delinquent and lazy school girls. In their efforts to cut remedial summer math class, they end up poisoning and replacing the schools brass band.

10596: Dana Andrews — in one of the best performances of his career — plays Logan Stuart, a bold, ambitious general store and freight company owner based in the mining settlement of Jacksonville, OR, in 1856.

34643: Desert Storm vet who was killed in combat rises from the grave on July Fourth, to kill the unpatriotic citizens of his hometown, after some teens burn an American flag over his burial site.

37834: After his death, a man returns to the landscape of his childhood and relives the relationship that was meant to last forever.

4068: An Ivy League professor is lured back to his Oklahoma hometown, where his twin brother, a small-time pot grower, has concocted a scheme to take down a local drug lord.

29150: Unethical surgeon Dr. Bill Cortner is developing a technique of transplantation of organs and members using a serum against rejection. When he has a car accident with his girlfriend, he saves her head only, and tries to find a woman with a beautiful body to transplant her head against her will.

37448: A companion piece to the earlier film, ‘The Death of Epedocles’, ‘Schwarze Sünde’ (Black Sin) is an adaptation of the third version of Friedrich Hölderlin’s play, ‘Der Tod Des Empedokles’.

35865: A door opens and in steps someone in a dark trench coat. He approaches a bed in the room, where a shirtless man sleeps. The intruder takes out a knife. His movements are without haste, but deliberate and efficient. Will his sleeping victim awake in time to offer resistance?

93165: A hedge-fund magnate is in over his head, desperately trying to complete the sale of his trading empire before the depths of his fraud are revealed. An unexpected, bloody error forces him to turn to the most unlikely corner for help.

113247: A wolf strives through the woods around an isolated German village. Jakob the young local police officer is onto him, but scents something more in the darkness. What he finds is a man, it seems, wild eyed, of wiry build, in a dress. He carries a katana, a Samurai sword.

14948: Adapted from the 2001 novel of the same name by John le Carré, a British diplomat seeks answers in the death of his activist wife, which leads to a much larger international conspiracy.

91050: In a futuristic, antiseptic food factory, workers select healthy chicks, while the rejects are carried along a conveyor belt until they are crushed by a mallet and drop into a garbage bin. A single black chick appears and before the mallet strikes, he rebels.

34727: An account of the most important event in recorded history. Little Delmer builds a peculiar contraption out of whatever he can find. What the machine actually does is a big surprise, even for him.

5356: Three sons who work in the family construction business help their overbearing mother celebrate her anniversary to her late husband.

1290: Zaza is almost 32 and his family wants to see him married. Zaza has kept his love for Judith secret because she’s a divorcee with a six-year-old daughter. In a crucial turning point charged with family antics, laughter and tears, Zaza will have to choose between love and respect of tradition.

32960: A look at the life and work of the sorcerer Alejandro Jodorowsky. Features an interview with Alejandro Jodorowsky and contributions from others.

29398: Through the extremely raging playthings of the words of Catalan poet Joan Brossa, Pere Portabella, in his first work as a director, attempts to dismantle the forms of advertising discourse of the time—Franco’s regime during the sixties.

30931: A bomber crew sees World War II action over the Pacific.

88955: The definitive biographical portrait of Harris Glenn Milstead, a.k.a. Divine, who has carved a place for herself in the temple of cinema in just the way he always deserved—as a serious artist and immortal star.

2337: François is a provincial orphan whose destructive behaviour precipitates his relocation from the home of a long-term foster family to the care of a benevolent elderly couple.

116313: A year after his father’s death, Victor returns to Buenos Aires in order to reconquer the life he was forced to abandon. He brings a new project with him for his former theater company: a radio-play of Shakespeare’s Love’s Labour’s Lost, a play they had all worked on together before he left.

30429: Set in Japan’s last surviving city, Tokyo-3, this apocalyptic drama focuses on the key players within NERV, a paramilitary force armed with piloted war machines that protect their retractable metropolis by battling giant beings called Angels.

1058: A photographer obsessed with a wealthy man’s beautiful wife kills her jealous husband in self-defense. The deceased man’s down-and-out musician son soon is drawn in by his sexy stepmother who, unbeknownst to him, is scheming to collect the entire estate.

2253: Fuller’s second study of the Korean War, focuses on a neophyte corporal, Denno (Richard Basehart), who is afraid to take a life. Denno watches his superiors get picked off one by one until he must take command. He soon learns of what he is truly capable and what he will do to survive.

33622: 1974 experimental short film based on Andy Warhol by Japanese director and video artist Toshio Matsumoto.

130097: A short film for Kenzo’s Autumn/Winter 2015 collections that is heavily inspired by Gregg Araki’s Teenage Apocalypse Trilogy.

3009: When a bored Holmes eagerly takes the case of Gabrielle Valladon after an attempt on her life, the search for her missing husband leads to Loch Ness and the legendary monster.
The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes

30855: Nelu, a man in his forties, works as a security guard in the local supermarket in Salonta, a small town on the Romanian-Hungarian border. This is the place where many illegal emigrants try to cross, by any means possible, to Hungary and then further to Western Europe. For Nelu, days go by the same.

32478: A true story about the greatest bank robbery in Norwegian history. The robbery itself is the main character of the story, and it is illuminated from several angles in the course of the film, from the perspective of the police, the robbers, the central cash service personnel, and ordinary people.

20370: Kanikosen is a highly stylized, stirring, manga-flavored update of a classic Japanese political novel, with labor unrest aboard a crab canning ship evolving into a cry of a younger generation aching to break the bonds of conformity.

40421: Albert is an inn owner who vowed never to drink again if he and his wife survived the war. They did, and the reformed alcoholic keeps his vow. But times have changed and soon after the war, Albert comes in contact with Gabriel, a young man prone to heavy bouts with the bottle.

22321: Javier Fresser’s emotional drama tells the true life tale of an eleven year old girl stricken with a terminal illness, and the influence of a powerful conservative Catholic organization during her last days.

106836: A man’s failed suicide attempt enables him to see ghosts.

105641: The place is an industrial area, where rusting steels flood under the cloudy sky. In front of a factory that stands groaning louder, “an old painter” sits quietly waiting for something, with his white canvas leaning on the easel. He meets “a girl” trying to bury her broken toy.

87456: In this “fourteen-part drill for the camera,” Frampton created a portrait gallery of his art-world friends engaging in a variety of ordinary activities.

42514: Is there really no third option for the characters in this short film of the great R omanian director Lucian Pintilie? A short film with many complex ramifications about history, honor, about how material value translates in life and survival.

104903: Thriller about a young man who commits a series of murders, because of a fixation dating from his childhood. An inspector of police disguised as a journalist tracks down the murderer with the help of a female teacher.

40939: The young warrior Son Goku sets out on a quest, racing against time and the vengeful King Piccolo, to collect a set of seven magical orbs that will grant their wielder unlimited power.

87532: One of the first films to feature more than one shot. Only the first shot of the elderly couple lunching outside the gallery survives. Stills exist of the other scene showing the man taking an interest in a nude statue to the irritation of his wife who moves him along.

47688: Arthur and Anatole are two little robbers. They want to rob money, money that will travel in a special train from Paris to Bruxelles. They don’t know that other people have planned to do the same thing.

25188: The one-Armed boxer is stalked by the vicious master of the flying guillotine, who’s looking to avenge the death of his disciples.

19902: Set in a blazing land where the sun ceaselessly shines, this dramatic fantasy examines love’s darker aspects.

105489: A music video from the French band Indochine.

25224: Rich and lonely Doriana Gray is interviewed by a journalist about her unusual life and her insane twin sister who was locked up since birth. Doriana is frigid while her sister is driven mad by the climaxes Doriana strives for.

47958: The true story of Ivan Sanchin, the KGB officer who was Stalin’s private film projectionist from 1939 until the dictator’s death.

25340: When The Maestro, a cult guru, urges Denis Byrd, a shy disciple, to make life a movie and be its star, the creative young man begins to film the oddball doings of his family and peers.

38453: After reading the diary of an elderly Jewish man who committed suicide, freelance journalist Peter Miller begins to investigate the alleged sighting of a former SS-Captain who commanded a concentration camp during World War II.

27311: The setting is Camp Firewood, the year 1981. It’s the last day before everyone goes back to the real world, but there’s still a summer’s worth of unfinished business to resolve…

49482: In this futuristic ’80s flick, successful businessman Sam Treadwell, accompanied by sexy gun-for-hire E. Johnson, travels to a post-apocalyptic wasteland on Earth.

36491: A short documentary on spinning tops.

28189: A toxic spill revives a beautiful, dead heiress who, with the help of her childhood friend, must quench her insatiable thirst for blood.

108724: A narcissistic artist finds his self-satisfied world turned upside down in the wake of a disastrous exhibition and his previously devoted wife’s extra-marital inclinations, in the touching and insightful new comedy-drama from Italian writer-director Daniele Luchetti.

12620: Three outlaws come to the aid of a young girl after her father is killed.

1013: Three stories of undying love: Bound by a long red cord, a young couple wanders in search of something they have forgotten…

11857: While travelling to visit their grandfather, two children are told the story of a family curse that has lasted two hundred years.

3042: An ordinary man makes an extraordinary discovery when a train collision leaves his fellow passengers dead and him unscathed. The revelation threatens to change his life forever.

675: In 1979, Louis Malle traveled into the heart of Minnesota to capture the everyday lives of the men and women in a prosperous farming community. Six years later, during Ronald Reagan’s second term, he returned to find drastic economic decline.

2218: The film consists of four episodes through which Roberto Rossellini’s impressions and feelings about India and its society emerge.

35452: The poignant tale of a young woman’s struggle with Bipolar Disorder, an illness that has haunted her all her life.
At the Very Bottom of Everything

4023: Susie, a plain young country girl, secretly loves a neighbor boy, William. She believes in him and sacrifices much of her own happiness to promote his own ambitions, all without his knowledge.

28341: Maria (Lina Romay) is sentenced to life in prison for the murder of her sexually abusive father.

31594: Ella Connors is a single woman who gets pressured to sell her failing cattle farm to her corrupt ex suitor, Jacob Ewing. She asks for help from her neighbor, Frank Athearn. As Ella and Frank fight back through stampedes, jealousy, betrayal, and sabotage…they eventually find love.

36659: The music video for “Windowlicker” is a ten-minute long parody of contemporary American gangsta hip-hop music videos.

6072: Set during the 1912 Balkan Wars, features Karloff as Greek general Pherides who, along with an American journalist, visits the gravesite of his late wife on a deserted island.

132321: The embalmed corpse of Eva Peron is taken to various cities throughout Europe before returning to her home in Argentina, where it is ultimately abducted.

37403: A young couple infiltrates a cult that meets in a basement in the San Fernando Valley.

17774: A woman hires a drifter as her guide through New Orleans in search of her father, who has gone missing. They discover a deadly game of cat and mouse behind his disappearance in the process.

28225: Kenji Koiso, an eleventh grade math genius, agrees to take a summer job at the Nagano hometown of his crush, Natuski. Meanwhile, his attempt to solve a mathematical equation causes a parallel world’s collision with earth.

4147: When Alice Hyatt (Ellen Burstyn) is suddenly widowed after years of domesticity, she decides to travel to Monterey, California with her 11-year-old son Tommy to resume a singing career.

152968: An old note is found in a bottle in Jutland which has traveled very long across the ocean a long time ago. The note is hard to decipher, but when the Danish investigator from Section Q receives it, the odd personalities within the section find a new angle on it.

55267: Detroit cop Axel Foley is back in sunny Southern California in the third installment of the comedic fish-out-of-water Beverly Hills Cop series. On the trail of two murderers, Axel again teams up with Los Angeles cop Billy Rosewood.

15367: A brave unicorn and a magician fight an evil king who is obsessed with capturing all the world’s unicorns.

1699: A labor union organizer comes to an embattled mining community brutally and violently dominated and harassed by the mining company.

29841: Sam Flynn is the tech-savvy orphaned son of the computer programmer who both created and was abducted by his videogame ‘The Grid’. When pulled into the same cybersphere as his father, Sam goes on a quest to stop the evil Clu from taking control of the world.

48052: The fledgling romance between Nick, a playboy bachelor, and Suzanne, a divorced mother of two, is threatened by a particularly harrowing New Year’s Eve. When Suzanne’s work keeps her in Vancouver for the holiday, Nick offers to bring her kids to the city from Portland, Oregon…

92736: Dutch film, based upon the classic 19th century S&M novel, chronicles the relationship between a dominatrix and her slave.

28703: Larson E. Whipsnade runs a seedy circus which is perpetually in debt. His performers give him nothing but trouble, especially Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy.
You Can't Cheat an Honest Man

33187: Bill, a wealthy businessman, confronts his junkie daughter’s drug-dealing boyfriend; in the ensuing argument, Bill kills him. Panic-stricken, he wanders the streets and eventually stops at a bar.

95887: An experienced male stripper — played by Channing Tatum, who once was one —initiates a novice into the tricks of the trade.

16008: Wedding crashers John Beckwith and Jeremy Grey, Washington D.C.’s top divorce mediators and lifelong best friends, have never met a wedding they couldn’t charm their way into.

29559: Two girls break out of their mental hospital for a night of fun, but things don’t go according to plan.

35010: The supervillain Megamind finally conquers his nemesis, the hero Metro Man… but finds his life pointless without a hero to fight.

237: Two sisters, Karin and Maria keep vigil for a third, Agnes, who is dying of cancer. Jealousy, manipulation, and selfishness come before empathy when Agnes finds true solace in the arms of a beatific servant.

5597: Isabelle’s life revolves around the New York bookshop she works in and the intellectual friends of both sexes she meets there. Her grandmother remains less than impressed and decides to hire a good old-fashioned Jewish matchmaker to help Isabelle’s love-life along.

3400: A diabolic serial killer tortures his morally wayward victims in order to teach them the value of life. Once captured, they face an obstacle course of difficult decisions in their abductors sadistic game of survival.

113486: Hugo, a melancholy man in his forties, works as a civil servant in a stuffy office in Lisbon. It’s a murky building with badly lit corridors and solid furniture. Or is this only a reflection of his mental state?

94971: Working in a Boston homeless shelter, Nick Flynn (Paul Dano) re-encounters his father (Robert De Niro), a con man and self-proclaimed poet. Sensing trouble in his own life, Nick wrestles with the notion of reaching out yet again to his dad.

32071: Jo lives in the shadow of his older brother. Petty delinquents, they are both interested in car-racing. One evening they compete, but never reach the finishing line. Jo is to become Jonathan.

30020: Fred and Tony are members of an elite ‘special squad’ of police in Rome, Italy whom are licensed-to-kill, undercover cops whom thrive on living dangerously.
Live Like a Cop, Die Like a Man

1451: In the late 1970’s, two disaffected and disillusioned college students find each other as they leave their previous relationships and plans for the future behind them.

13038: The true story of a disillusioned military contractor employee and his drug pusher childhood friend who became walk-in spies for the Soviet Union.

1949: Three young American women, studying in Rome, are lured into a hostel by a beautiful young woman who sells them as the next victims of a murder-for-profit business.

32115: Based on a true story, political drama set in 1963 Johannesburg, about an anti-apartheid activist and her 13-year-old daughter. Winner of three prizes at the Cannes Film Festival, including Best Actress for Barbara Hershey and the Grand Prix.

29791: Einar and Eric are two Viking half-brothers. The former is a great warrior whilst the other is an ex-slave, but neither knows the true identity of the other. When the throne of Northumbria in Britain becomes free for the taking, the two brothers compete against one another for the prize.

3564: A greedy landowner and his backward nephew conspire to block the only water source for an adjoining property in order to bankrupt the owner and force him to sell.

92982: All summer, the grasshopper sings, plays music, and visits with it’s friends. Meanwhile, the ant works hard collecting food and building a shelter. The grasshopper makes light of the ant’s strenuous efforts, but when winter comes, things are much different.

97662: A chronicle of the LAPD’s fight to keep East Coast Mafia types out of Los Angeles in the 1940s and 50s.

353: After learning that his stomach cancer has left him with less than a year to live, a Tokyo bureaucrat struggles to reconcile with his impending death and begins looking for ways to make his remaining days meaningful.

1535: As nervy as it is hilarious, this screwball masterpiece from Ernst Lubitsch stars Jack Benny and, in her final screen appearance, Carole Lombard as husband-and-wife thespians in Nazi-occupied Warsaw who become caught up in a dangerous spy plot.
To Be or Not to Be

14291: In the 1830’s beaver trapper Flint Mitchell and other white men hunt and trap in the then unnamed territories of Montana and Idaho. Flint marries a Blackfoot woman as a way to gain entrance into her people’s rich lands, but finds she means more to him than a ticket to good beaver habitat.

37289: A female psychologist wants to understand the minds of a confessed serial killer who spent the last five years in a mental hospital because of his state.

3918: Jacques d’Athys returns from an expedition to Indochina where he picks up a book that contains the whereabouts of secret treasures and sensitive government intelligence. This makes him the target of foreign spies, including a Marquise of Latin origin, a Hindu hypnotist and an evil German doctor.

27753: Yet another variation on the Three Little Pigs theme, this time told as WW2 anti-German propaganda (the US had just entered the war), with the wolf as a thinly-disguised Hitler.

45053: Tom is slow to respond to the friendly overtures of a puppy whom Jerry saved from drowning.

44209: A female blackmailer with a disfiguring facial scar meets a plastic surgeon who offers her the possibility of looking like a normal woman.

26975: The pioneers of hard rock take the stage — and blow your mind. Led Zeppelin storm Madison Square Garden in this collection of footage taken from their legendary performances at the New York venue in 1973.

38011: A dark and stormy night; a knock on the door of the pig family. It’s lawyer Goodwill, with Uncle Solomon’s will which leaves everything to the pigs, but if something happens to them, it goes to the lawyer who then immediately adjourns to the basement and a convenient bottle of Jekyll and Hyde potion
The Case of the Stuttering Pig

41195: A young man, armed with a magical bow and arrows, embarks on a mystical journey through a mystical land to rid it of all evil and joins forces with an outlaw to take down an evil witch bent on claiming the magic bow for evil.

His paintings prove unpopular, so he supports himself by caricatures until an offer to engage in forgery becomes to good to refuse.

23695: Nick Zedd’s They Eat Scum is a unique ultra-lo-budget punk rock cinema classic. Trashy, nihilistic and subversive.

47002: The time has come for players to carve their name in history. One touch, tackle or free kick could crush a nation’s hopes or cause them to build a statue in your honour.

26811: The calm suburban life of the well-situated Brewer family is unexpectedly turned upside down by the shocking death of the elder son Bennett. Father, mother, and younger brother try to cope with the sudden loss of a loved one each in his or her own way.

Conquest of the Planet of the Apes

23539: Andy Warhol directs a single shot of a man’s face to capture his facial expressions as he receives the sexual act depicted in the title.

27883: A widowed mother and her son change when a mysterious stranger enters their lives.

22763: This experimental film shows different shapes applied at different times. A cacophony of animated geometric figures appear in succession, much like a musical piece where idioms or themes emerge.

103394: Experimental film which attempts to communicate in strictly cinematographic terms the emotions of a pregnant woman alone.

20732: An ensemble drama about a married actress, her sister and their myriad sexual and creative temptations.

43268: A secret service agent is framed as the mole in an assassination attempt on the president. He must clear his name and foil another assassination attempt while on the run from a relentless FBI agent.

23945: When Charlotte (Sylvie Testud) takes her widowed mother (Aurore Clément) into her apartment, the ensuing clutter drives her to distraction.

1866: The famous “Lubitsch touch,” all silky innuendo, is amply evident in this lovely comedy about plain-talking plumber Cluny Brown (Jennifer Jones, in possibly her best performance), who is hired as a maid in a posh British manor, where she blithely breaches class divisions.

108249: Hugh Jackman plays a desperate father whose life is shattered when his six-year-old daughter and her friend go missing on Thanksgiving, prompting him to take matters into his own hands.

70955: When the 243-year-old Mr. Magorium discovers his health is failing, he turns over his fantastical toy store to his manager, Molly Mahoney, a talented pianist and aspiring composer who isn’t sure she’s ready to take the reins.

28898: Against the backdrop of Pope John Paul II’s 1997 visit to Rio de Janeiro, ten intensely religious people tell the story of their lives and their spiritual trajectories, unveiling differences between the various evangelical churches, the practices of Umbanda, and popular Catholicism.

94546: Outlaw Wes McQueen is sprung from jail to help pull one last railroad job. He doesn’t like his new partners – except dance-hall girl Colorado – and anyway fancies Julie Ann newly arrived from the east to set up home with her father.

92: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

3837: Describes a journey taken across the social, economic, and psychological tobacco terrain of North Carolina by a native Carolinian, Ross McElwee, whose great-grandfather created the famous brand of tobacco known as Bull Durham.

2775: Two individual fates move in opposite directions. Olga, a nurse from Ukraine, abandons her family to look for a better life in the West. Paul, an unemployed security guard from Vienna, is looking for a reason to get up in the mornings and heads East with his stepfather.

28580: The life stories of the six men who raised the flag at The Battle of Iwo Jima, a turning point in WWII.

318: When the dead start to come back to life as murderous zombies, several people find shelter in an old farmhouse, barricading themselves from the bloodthirsty creatures.

51404: Seasoned spies and sisters Ai Lin and Ai Quan take over their family’s computer surveillance business and use their advanced technology to carry out the murder of a wealthy Chinese businessman.

11146: And Now for Something Completely Different

1902: A documentary on the treatment of Palestianians by members of the Israeli army.
Avenge But One of My Two Eyes

149435: A chronicled look at the criminal exploits of Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar.

31355: School teacher Ichikawa (Sho Aikawa), sometimes known as Zebraman, suddenly awakes 15 years later in the year 2025. The megapolis known as Tokyo has now been renamed to Zebra City. The city has become virtually crime free due to a new measure known as “Zebra Time.”

89331: Tells of family conflict and friendship goes where between individuals, with different backgrounds, have relationships with one another. The relationship between family and individual issues related to differences in these views, status, religion and ethnicity.

95678: This is a documentary about a kind of music that describes a whole realm of its own, namely, the manic, mad, dramatic world of the Balkans. The No Smoking band was founded 20 years ago in former Yugoslavia.

93443: Divorced, childless, demoralized and condemned to move back in with her parents at the age of 35, Amy Minsky’s (Melanie Lynskey) prospects look bleak – until the unexpected attention of a teenage boy changes everything.

97585: Inspired by the facts, and maybe some of the fictions, surrounding the too-short life of cinematic icon James Dean (James Preston), the movie is a rumination on the dream of being a star and its subsequent costs.
Joshua Tree, 1951: A Portrait of James Dean

56465: Three troubled teenagers are given a second chance when Capt. Adam Greer offers to expunge their criminal records if they go undercover for the Los Angeles Police Department in this stylish crime flick inspired by the classic television series.

93527: During the sea battle which took place between the Ottoman Empire and the Italians, a ship which had been seized in the Mediterranean Sea is brought to Istanbul, and a young wounded lady named Francesca, the daughter of the killed Captain, becomes a slave for Hezarfen Ahmet Celebi.

32396: At the end of the war, Nostos, the wandering hero, with his companions begins his sail back home to the Mediterranean.

29512: The Life and Death of Peter Sellers

23416: In the post-apocalyptic future, only a few humans are left. No one is able to speak; the film contains no dialogue, and characters communicate non-verbally. A determined loner befriends a reclusive older man and these two battle against vicious thugs for food, shelter and life itself.

25581: Anti-Semitism, race relations, coming of age, and fathers and sons: in Baltimore from fall, 1954, to fall, 1955.

18081: Two desperate people have a wonderful romance, but their political views and convictions drive them apart.

21447: Monumental picture exploring the identity and fate of the Armenian nation.

22728: She Spent So Many Hours Under the Sun Lamps

23572: Serial Killer Fritz Haarmann (Gotz George) has finally been caught after years of preying on boys and young men.

21523: It shocked and delighted audiences the world over. It was seized by US Customs, restricted to screenings in private clubs in London and Paris and terrified the Mary Whitehouse establishment. Welcome to the aftermath of Frank Ripploh–school teacher, film director and insatiable sex addict!

99547: A close-up look at sand urchins and rock urchins. At the seashore, Jean Painlevé digs up a sand urchin. We look closely…

106043: A surrealist animated short from Argentina which takes place in a world where every single activity, even those that are supposed to be made by objects and artifacts are done by ordinary humans, who “work” playing the role of mirrors, tables and automobiles in everyday life.

100278: A lonely young woman lives with her strict father who forbids her to wear make-up.

78964: Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway star as Emma and Liv, best friends who become worst enemies when they realize their respective weddings are scheduled on the same day at their dream venue — the Plaza Hotel.

101022: A commercial for the Works Progress Administration. We see hands close up: working, playing, praying…

45018: Tom designs a better mousetrap. While he sleeps, the mouse that Tom drew wakes Jerry, and they get chased by the cat that Tom drew. As Tom awakes, they make a strategic alteration to the design.

103073: A warlock flees from the 17th to the 20th century, with a witch-hunter in hot pursuit.

102229: Belle prepares the castle for Christmas against Beast’s wishes, trying to bring him happiness for the season. Forte, a pipe organ, fears that Belle’s plans may eventually bring about an end to the curse… the curse that brought him more importance in the Master’s life.
Beauty and the Beast: The Enchanted Christmas

24513: Serge meets Evelyn Nicholson, a twenty-three-year-old English beauty. He falls passionately in love with her and, as a result, starts neglecting his charming wife, Françoise, going so far as to consider divorcing her.

24477: A suave paroled thief assembles a group of ten conmen in order to pull off an elaborate and complex heist, robbing three high-security Las Vegas casinos all at once.

46377: A disaffected Goth girl and a young male Internet voyeur connect in this offbeat exploration of the Japanese subculture of video surveillance.

118793: A separated couple meet again after 10 years when the body of their missing son is found. Amid the guilt of losing a loved one, they hesitantly move toward affirmation of life, acceptance of death, and even the possibility of reconciliation.

19857: Troubled with union problems in his business and lonely on his birthday because his wife, Martha, is out with a playboy, millionaire Timothy Borden meets unemployed and hungry Mary Grey in a park and convinces her to help him celebrate at a nightclub.

38462: This is a life story of three girlfriends from youth to autumn ages. Their dreams and wishes, love, disillusions. Different careers. And big late love.
Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears

119095: In a mysterious and remote snowy outpost, Matt and Potter share an interesting Christmas meal together, swapping creepy tales of their earlier lives in the outside world.

47471: A young widow discovers that her late husband has left her 10 messages intended to help ease her pain and start a new life.

25371: A man calling himself Boris, arrives in a village in Central Europe, claiming to have been a friend of a local lad who disappeared since the war. His conflicting tale gives rise to doubts about his story.

104786: Asterix crosses the channel to help second-cousin Anticlimax face down Julius Caesar and invading Romans.
Astérix and Obélix: God Save Britannia

27320: In the last days of WWII, an group of schoolboys are called up to defend their small German town against the impending American advance.

98089: A rugged drama of initiation set in an isolated part of northeastern Japan. A young man tries to overcome the hostility of his girlfriend’s father, a tuna fisherman, by getting the older man to teach him the secrets of his dangerous trade.

67662: Dancer Shizuko is married to a wealthy businessman who lets his high-pressure job get in the way of his home life. In other words, he ignores her. As a result, Shizuko begins having masochistic fantasies, unaware that they’d soon come true.

47515: Goofy tries to set up his new home theater in time for the big game, with disastrous results.
How to Hook Up Your Home Theatre

23382: Catherine Breillat’s controversial exploration of a teenage girl’s sexuality, based on her own novel.

86889: A 1901 British short silent comedy film featuring a magician using his magic to aid an ailing girl at the request of her brother, which provides an excellent illustration of how effects used sparingly can often have more impact.

40574: A thoughtful and only occasionally winking meta-comment on metaphysics and documentary objectivity in film.

87503: A 1906 British short silent comedy film featuring a motorist driving around the rings of Saturn to escape the police, which draws on a wide range of the visual tricks that Booth had developed over the preceding half-decade.

20341: About a widower whose book about coping with loss turns him into a best-selling self-help guru. On a business trip to Seattle, he falls for a woman who attends one of his seminars, only to learn that he hasn’t yet truly confronted his wife’s passing.

61825: Eric Bana (Troy) stars as a gifted young poker player working to beat his personal demons and win the World Series of Poker in Las Vegas. In the process, he connects with a struggling musician and his obstinate father.

40410: The story picks up seven years after the first film when little sister Samantha Darko and her best friend Corey are now 18 and on a roadtrip to Los Angeles when they are plagued by bizarre visions.

4176: A career oriented magazine editor finds himself on the run when he discovers his boss is framing him for murder.

28214: The earliest extant Rossellini film. Undersea creatures shot through an aquarium.

51390: On an island off the coast of Florida, a college rave party is in full swing. But the kids’ X-laced escapades are soon interrupted by zombies and monsters that attack them on the ground, from the air and in the sea.

34639: A quiet pawnshop keeper with a violent past takes on a trafficking ring in hope of saving a young child.

5248: The sole survivor of an ill-fated mining expedition tells how his taste for gold was replaced by that of human flesh.

2185: King Vidor’s unclassifiable, delirious western stars Jennifer Jones as Pearl Chavez, a half-breed who becomes caught between warring brothers.

17621: In the civil war, an injured Yankee soldier is rescued by a teen girl from a southern boarding school. She gets him to the school. At first the all-female staff and pupils are scared. As he recovers, one by one he charms them and the atmosphere becomes filled with jealousy and deceit.

28370: The treasure seeking adventures of young Jim Hawkins and pirate captain Long John Silver.

35463: Lena is bitten by Louise, leader of a female vampire trio that are as deadly as they are beautiful. Her newfound vampiric lifestyle is a blessing and a curse at the same time. At first, she enjoys the limitless freedom but soon Lena will have to choose between immortal love and immortal life…

4012: In a city under siege in the dark days of war, a strange old man appears, claiming to be the “Baron Munchausen” from fairy tales and legends.

111308: The Beatles sang the vocals live over the pre-recorded instrumental track from the single version.

55332: Daniela survived a brutal rape and is now hell-bent on making those responsible for torturing her pay for their crime. Plagued by dreams that she’s a werewolf, Daniela begins roaming the countryside seducing men and then killing them.

33988: When a Russian musician defects in Bloomingdale’s department store in New York, he finds adjusting to American life more difficult than he imagined.

7219: After Larry Darrent accidentally kills his lover’s blackmailing husband, someone else is arrested for the crime. When he is found guilty, Larry and Wanda have just three weeks together before he must give himself up or let an innocent man go to the gallows.

994: A rare gem of cinematic storytelling that weaves docudrama, fictional reenactment, and experimental photography into a powerful, reflective work on the early days of German cinema.

36668: For Joseph, a man plagued by self-destructive violence and rage, a chance of redemption appears in the form of Hannah, a Christian charity shop worker with a devastating secret of her own.

1022: Somewhere in Taiwan, the rain won’t stop. A mysterious disease reaches epidemic proportions… A young man uses the sizeable hole in his living room floor to spy on his downstairs neighbor, an attractive woman who stockpiles toilet paper…

11866: A group of American vets damaged by World War I live it up in Paris after the war in this Hemingway-inspired effort.

52353: Jane Marple is thrilled when two glamorous Hollywood actresses, Marina Rudd and Lola Brewster, arrive in her quaint English village to shoot a movie. It’s soon apparent, however, that the two actresses loathe each other.

30453: The President of the United States and the Prime Minister of England have traditionally had a special working relationship, and allies draw closer when Tony Blair’s election gives Bill Clinton a political soul mate at the helm of the UK.

2229: Someone we hear talking – but whom we do not see – speaks of a project which describes the four key moments of love: meeting, physical passion, arguments and separation, making up. This is told through three couples.

12775: The title of this David Cronenberg sci-fi horror film refers to a group of people who have telekinetic powers that allow them to read minds and give them the ability to make other people’s heads explode.

720: In 1967, at the height of the Summer of Love, the first and only Monterey International Pop Festival roared forward, capturing a decade’s spirit and ushering in a new era of rock and roll. Monterey would launch the careers of Jimi Hendrix, Janis Joplin, and Otis Redding, but they were just a few.

9290: Master Chinese filmmaker Zhang Yimou turns his lens on the travails of modern China’s peasants. When teacher Gao (Gao Enman) leaves town for a month, 13-year old Wei (Wei Minzhi) is pressed into serving as his substitute at the school from which she just graduated.

Berlin: Symphony of a Great City

44885: Concert footage and backstage documentary of singer Elvis Presley.
Elvis: That's the Way It Is

42912: An Irish journalist writes a series of stories about drug dealers.

25096: A young man watches a group of teenagers playing basketball. Suddenly the four lads chase him and start terrorizing him. Or so it seems.

119372: A fantastical tale based on true events, about five women of Signe Baumane’s family, including herself, and their battles with depression and madness.

38785: Set against the backdrop of the 1967 Six-Day War, the movie adaptation of Naguib Mahfouz’s novel follows the escapist, drug-fuelled riverboat meetings of a group of frustrated Egyptians from various walks of life.

23101: The story about the first love of the sixteen-year-old boy Anton is brilliantly painted on glass.

OMR: The Way We Have Chosen

8366: The macho students of an elite US Flying school for advanced fighter pilots compete to be best in the class, and one romances the teacher.

81773: In a bid to illustrate how fear rules most people’s lives, a writer crafts a tale of star-crossed lovers who want to marry, despite their families’ — and their own — obvious differences in this theatrical foreign-language comedy.

101949: Film featuring the character Fantozzi, who after a lifetime of mistreatment as an accountant of a huge corporation attempts clumsily to avenge himself and gain some self-esteem, usually failing in all situations and attempts.

26055: As allied POWs prepare for a soccer game against the German National Team to be played in Nazi-occupied Paris, the French Resistance and British officers are making plans for the team’s escape.

117178: The Philippines is the most storm-battered country in the world. In 2013 Typhoon Yolanda, considered the strongest storm in history, struck the Philippines, leaving in its path apocalyptic devastation. A few months later, Lav Diaz visited Tacloban Island to film children lives in the aftermath.

15597: An overstressed suburbanite and his paramilitaric neighbor struggle to prove their paranoid theory that the new family in town is a front for a cannibalistic cult.

52318: In this live-action film based on the popular Disneyland attraction, a 10-year-old bear named Beary (voiced by Haley Joel Osment) finds out he’s adopted and heads to Tennessee to seek his family and purpose in life.

1069: An intimate portrait of poet, painter, musician and singer Patti Smith that mirrors the essence of the artist.  Winner of a prize for cinematography at the Sundance Film Festival.

3038: When the young woman Tristana’s mother dies, she is entrusted to the guardianship of the well-respected though old Don Lope. Don Lope is well-liked and well-known because of his honorable nature, despite his socialistic views about business and religion.

30864: In the final days of the Vietnam War, a psychiatrist, Col. Kane, takes charge of an experimental military facility studying soldiers who appear to have suffered a psychotic break.

11451: Set in Jakarta, the film involves the romance between high school girl Cinta (played by Southeast Asian pop singer and teen magazine cover girl Dian Sastrowardoyo) and a boy named Rangga (Nicholas Saputra).

88800: 1660, England. Amber St. Clair aims to raise herself from a country girl to nobility, and succeeds, but loses her true love in the process.

33613: Icelandic master Fridrik Thor Fridriksson returns with this disarmingly honest, semi-autobiographical portrait of a filmmaker’s relationship with his ailing mother.

109978: Levan Koguashvili’s film — about a lonely 40-year-old schoolteacher who takes up with the wife of a soon-to-be-released convict — is a compassionate tragicomedy commenting on relationships and the profound emotional responsibilities they trigger.

33777: Step Across the Border is a 1990 avant-garde documentary film on English guitarist, composer and improviser Fred Frith. It was written and directed by Nicolas Humbert and Werner Penzel.

2306: Three sisters (Diane Keaton, Mary Beth Hurt, Kristin Griffith) find their lives spinning out of control in the wake of their parents’ sudden, unexpected divorce, in Woody Allen’s homage to Ingmar Bergman.

13918: Charlie works on a farm from 4am to late at night. He gets his food on the run (milking a cow into his coffee, holding an chicken over the frying pan to get fried eggs). He loves the neighbor’s daughter Edna but is disliked by her father…

30900: A horror film director is stalked by a mad psychiatrist/serial killer bent on killing people to model the killings after the director’s gory death scenes from his movies.

4291: An architect senses impending doom as his half-remembered recurring dream turns into reality. The guests at the country house encourage him to stay as they take turns telling supernatural tales.

34716: From 1952 until his death in 2003, Stan Brakhage created almost 400 films.  Spanning decades, this documentary delves into the essence of his experimental body of work.

5367: The destiny of three soldiers during World War II. The German officer Christian Diestl approves less and less of the war. Jewish-American Noah Ackerman deals with anti-Semitism at home and in the army while entertainer Michael Whiteacre transforms from playboy to hero.

89892: Animated film about a flying camera which is exploring space and sets up its len s on a planet full of strange beings.

32681: Three teenagers Huda, Rian, and Syahid attend a pesantren (Islamic religious school) in a small Indonesian village. With only a month left before graduation their lives change dramatically when they are suddenly arrested on suspicions of terrorist ties following September 11, 2001

113276: The industrial city of Norilsk, with its arctic landscapes, huge factories, and anonymous Soviet architecture, is the gripping backdrop of The Hope Factory, the first feature by young Russian film maker Natalia Meschaninova.

29005: Junie Moon’s face has been disfigured by ill-gotten burns, and depends on her friends and her wit to cope…
Tell Me That You Love Me, Junie Moon

35930: One of the most nihilistic “Pink” films ever made.

14505: Ace Ventura emerges from a self-imposed exile in a remote Himalayan hideaway. He travels to Africa with explorer Fulton Greenwall, where he must find a sacred albino bat before the Wachootoo and Wachati tribes start fighting a savage war.

12492: After Charlie Chaplin and Buster Keaton, the silent film era’s “third genius” was Harold Lloyd, who stars in this Horatio Alger-style story of an average country boy trying to make good in the big city.

54047: Adapted from Peter Carey’s novel, this romantic drama centers on feminist Australian heiress Lucinda and British missionary Oscar. Both have a penchant for gambling, and sparks fly when they meet aboard an Australian-bound ship.

108596: A Spell to Ward Off the Darkness

29161: An orthodox Jewish blaxploitation hero saves Hanukkah from the clutches of Santa Claus’s evil son.

3394: Computer hacker Neo discovers that reality as we know it is a simulation used to control the human population. With this new knowledge he must join the rebellion to fight this, even if it means accepting a life of danger.
